title: Spunky little thing
text: Unusable on Windows PC.  Didn't test it on a mobile device so I don't know.Bought JBL Clip 3 intending to replace Echo Dot with it (because I simply could not live with Alexa making that pretentious machine-recorded announcement when you absolutely don't want to hear anything, say 2am in the morning).But the JBL is absolutely unusable for a simple reason:  it never maintains a connection with a Windows 10 PC, which is what I intend to use it with.Every 10 minutes, it automatically turns off.  That in itself may be OK, if it can manage to reconnect automatically next time when it is used. But it cannot. Every time after it has automatically turned off, it will require a manual re-connection. And it is not just a one-click kind of reconnection. It's a multistep reconnection very much like the initial pairing.  Completely unusable.I didn't try it with a mobile device, so I don't know about if it will automatically reconnect there. But with Windows 10 PC, forget it.In addition, it shares the same gimmicky and inconvenient volume control as Amazon Echo. I guess that's where the world has gone.To the credit of JBL, it does have great sound quality, on par with that of Amazon Echo which is excellent. And it has a 10-hour battery, meaning it is truly wireless in regular operation (in contrast, Echo has to be constantly powered, therefore even though it's Bluetooth, it always has an AC adapter connected, making it much messier).JBL is also much smaller, which is a good thing considering that the sound quality is about the same (because usually it is harder to make a smaller speak to sound good - basic acoustics).  But all these benefits don't matter what it could not maintain a connection.The bottom line is that I simply cannot use this product due to its inability to sustain a connection.  All other merits don't mean a thing.

title: Stopped working
text: Loved everything about this little speaker until the IPX7 waterproof was put through a very mild test and completely failed.I’ve seen videos of people using this speaker while it’s submerged in a bowl of water without the face plate and things were totally fine. Throwing it in the ocean, etc.However, I recently went tubing and brought my Clip 3. Easy float, very few rapids, mostly just coasting. There was one particular drop where the speaker went completely underwater for maybe five seconds, max.It worked fine for the remainder of the float. A little warbled from some water blocking holes in the face plate, but they dried out quickly.Fast forward to just over a week later and we’re getting ready to head out for another float, only to find that if the Clip 3 isn’t plugged in, it doesn’t function. The battery is charged, the indicator light is a solid white when it’s plugged in.Took off the face plate to take a peek down in the battery well and it’s SOAKED. Literally sopping wet, all of the foam pieces inside are drenched, there are visible water droplets sitting on the battery.I’m super bummed. Dunno if I just got a faulty model or what, but my particular JBL Clip 3 is certainly not “waterproof“ for 30 minutes submerged in 3 meters of water.

text: Sound quality is decent.Now let’s get to the bad:The clip is terrible.  I got a first speaker and the pin fell out of the clip during normal use.  It is possible to put the clip back in and reassemble the speaker but it is a super tiny pin and is going to be very hard to spot in most places.  I got a replacement speaker and the same thing happened again.  Unfortunately I am now 2 days past the return window on the second one.  I would recommend gluing the pin in if you buy this speaker.  I can’t think of any reason it needs to be so easily removable.The face cover fell off the first one I got and was able to be put back on but kept falling off during normal use.  I wound up losing the cover at the disc golf course but luckily someone found it and I got it back so I could return it.The battery life is definitely 3-4 hours and nowhere near 10.I would highly recommend looking elsewhere for a Bluetooth speaker if you are going to be using it a decent amount.
